title: Advances in Minimally Invasive Spine Surgery: A Comprehensive Review
abstract: This comprehensive review examines the latest advances in minimally invasive spine surgery techniques, including robotic assistance, navigation systems, and patient outcomes.
content: Minimally invasive spine surgery (MISS) has revolutionized the field of spine surgery over the past two decades. This article provides a comprehensive review of current techniques, technologies, and outcomes...

title: Robotic-Assisted Spine Surgery: Current Status and Future Directions
abstract: This article explores the current state of robotic-assisted spine surgery, including available systems, clinical applications, and future developments in the field.
content: Robotic-assisted surgery has emerged as a promising technology in spine surgery, offering enhanced precision and improved patient outcomes. This article reviews current robotic systems...

title: Patient Outcomes Following Artificial Disc Replacement: A 5-Year Follow-up Study
abstract: This study presents 5-year follow-up results of patients who underwent artificial disc replacement, comparing outcomes with traditional fusion procedures.
content: Artificial disc replacement (ADR) has been proposed as an alternative to traditional fusion procedures, with the potential to preserve motion and reduce adjacent segment disease...

title: Complex Spine Deformity Correction: Surgical Techniques and Outcomes
abstract: This article describes surgical techniques for complex spine deformity correction, including scoliosis, kyphosis, and combined deformities.

title: Biologics in Spine Surgery: Current Applications and Future Prospects
abstract: This review article examines the current use of biologics in spine surgery, including bone morphogenetic proteins, stem cells, and growth factors.
content: Biologics have become an integral part of modern spine surgery, offering potential benefits for bone healing and fusion. This article reviews current applications...
